Item.SEODescription: The SharePoint Framework provides a modern developer experience for extending SharePoint.
Learn about the tools and libriaries you will need to use to build your SharePoint Framework solutions.
Set up an Office 365 tenant so that you can test and debug your SharePoint client-side web parts
Set up and configure your development environment to build SharePoint client-side web parts
The SharePoint Framework toolchain is the set of build tools, framework packages, and other items that manage building and deploying your client side projects.
Process how to update SharePoint Framework packages to latest versions in your solutions.
Extend Webpack in the build pipeline used in SharePoint Framework solutions.
Develop SharePoint client-side web parts to provide a better customized experience for SharePoint.
Build a hello world SharePoint client-side web part.
Connect your SharePoint client-side web part to SharePoint by using page context.

Item.text: Deploy your web part to a SharePoint page
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part to a SharePoint page.
Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part assets to a CDN instead of using a local host.
Add the jQueryUI Accordian to your SharePoint client-side web part project.

Item.text: Use Office UI Fabric React components
Item.SEODescription: Build a SharePoint client-side web part that uses the DocumentCard Office UI Fabric component.
Design your SharePoint client-side web parts to use Office UI Fabric React components, be responsive, and handle publish and edit modes.

Item.text: Add properties to the property pane
Item.SEODescription: Set up properties for your SharePoint client-side web part and manage them through the property pane.
Add an external JavaScript library to your SharePoint client-side web part such as small libraries, non-AMD modules, and localized resources.
Learn how to use the __REQUESTDIGEST form field in a web part in the SharePoint Framework
Understand definition details for files used for packaging web parts in solutions in the SharePoint Framework
Best practices for using existing JavaScript libraries in your SharePoint client-side web parts.
Reference third party CSS styles in your SharePoint Framework client-side web parts.
Simplify adding web parts with preconfigured entries.
Validate property pane entries from end users.

Item.text: Use cascading dropdowns in property pane
Item.SEODescription: Using cascading dropdowns in property pane of your SharePoint Framework client-side web part.

Item.text: Build custom controls for the property pane
Item.SEODescription: Build custom controls for additional functionality for the property pane of your SharePoint Framework client-side web part.

Item.text: Build web parts with Angular v1.x
Item.SEODescription: Use Angular 1.x to build a simple SharePoint Framework client-side web part.
Migrating existing Angular v1.x applications to SharePoint Framework client-side web parts.
Localize SharePoint Framework client-side web parts.
Call the Microsoft Graph API from your SharePoint Framework client-side web part using OAuth.
SharePoint webhooks allow developers to build service integrations which subscribe to receive notifications on specific events that occur in SharePoint.
Get started building your own application that can add and handle SharePoint webhook requests.
A SharePoint PnP sample reference implementation that shows how to use SharePoint webhooks using various Azure components such as Azure Web Jobs, Azure SQL Server and Azure Storage Queues.
Explains how to use Azure Functions for hosting your SharePoint webhooks
SharePoint list webhooks notify your application about the events corresponding to list item changes for a given SharePoint list or a document library.
Create a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP POST request.
Update a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP PATCH request.
Delete a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP DELETE request.
Get one or more SharePoint webhook subscriptions using an HTTP GET request.
SharePoint Framework API reference
SharePoint Framework Code Samples
